0.title: Satyamev Jayate: Jharkhand CM after SC allows his appeal against HC order
0.article_body: Reacting to Supreme Court's decision allowing his plea challenging Jharkhand High Court's order against him in the illegal mining case, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said, "Satyamev Jayate". He shared the news on his official Twitter handle. Earlier, the Supreme Court had restrained High Court from proceeding with the PILs seeking a probe against Soren in the mining lease issue.

1.title: Added some bits in Shiva & Isha's story for Brahmastra's OTT version: Ayan
1.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji said that he and music composer Pritam "refined the sound" of 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' and "added a few nips and tucks" to the film ahead of its OTT premiere. "I added some bits in Shiva and Isha's love story...subtle stuff. I believe that it will make the journey of the film a little smoother," he added.

2.title: Oppn leaders criticise demonetisation move, call it 'failure', 'jumla'
2.article_body: Ahead of the sixth anniversary of the demonetisation exercise, Opposition leaders criticised the move, calling it a "failure" and "jumla". Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said, "PM is yet to acknowledge...epic failure that led to fall of economy." Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed said, "Note bandi was nothing but a jumla." Meanwhile, TRS leader KTR called the move a "colossal failure".

3.title: No external injuries on 9-yr-old girl who died in B'luru school: Report
3.article_body: A preliminary forensic report on the death of a nine-year-old student at a school in Bengaluru has revealed no signs of external injuries on the girl's body, police sources said. The deceased girl collapsed in her school on Friday, following which her father, in a complaint, alleged that she might've died while students were being punished at the school.

4.title: 11-year-old boy dies after falling into open drain in Faridabad
4.article_body: An 11-year-old boy died after allegedly falling into an open drain in Faridabad on Saturday. The incident took place when the boy, Kunal, had gone to buy some items from a shop near his house, police said. The Municipal Corporation of Faridabad's sub-divisional officer and area joint engineer, along with the local councillor, have been booked for their alleged negligence.

5.title: Migrant rescue ship Humanity 1 refuses to leave Italian port
5.article_body: Migrant rescue ship Humanity 1 which was allowed to dock at Italy's Catania port on Sunday refused to leave the port later in the day. The captain refused Italian orders after authorities did not let the last remaining 35 migrants aboard the ship disembark. Authorities allowed 144 migrants, including 100 unaccompanied minors and people with medical emergencies, to get off.

6.title: Didn't go anywhere: Vijay Deverakonda on 'comeback' after 'Liger'
6.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has said that fans have come up to him asking him to make a comeback after the failure of his recent film 'Liger'. "Wherever I go, fans keep saying, anna (brother), you have to give a comeback. I wanted to tell you, I didn't go anywhere," he stated. The actor will next feature in 'Kushi'.

7.title: Bombarding Suryakumar with short balls is only way to dismiss him: Waqar
7.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis said "bombarding" Suryakumar Yadav with short deliveries is the best as well as the only way to dismiss him in T20s. "It's very difficult to bowl [to] him," added Waqar. Discussing Suryakumar's 61* off 25 balls in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe, ex-Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram stated, "Suryakumar has come from...[another] planet."

8.title: Sukesh's letter exposes AAP, a party of 'ugai, thagai & lutai': BJP
8.article_body: BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla on Monday shared a copy of jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar's letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena and called AAP a party of "ugai, thagai, lutai" (corruption, cheating and looting). BJP leader Meenakashi Lekhi on Sunday demanded AAP's Satyendar Jain be shifted to another prison, accusing Jain of running an extortion racket from jail.

9.title: 4 doctors booked for negligence after UK citizen dies in Gurugram
9.article_body: The Gurugram Police booked four doctors of a private hospital for medical negligence in connection with the death of a 22-year-old citizen of the United Kingdom in May. According to reports, he received serious injuries while parking his car. Based on the report of the medical negligence board, an FIR was registered at the Sector 50 police station on Friday.

10.title: I'd go with Pant over Karthik for T20 WC semi-final vs Eng: Shastri
10.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said he would pick Rishabh Pant over Dinesh Karthik in India's lineup for the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England. "Pant recently won a match on his [own] against England...You need a left-hander...who can...win you [the] game in the back overs," added Shastri. Shastri further termed Pant's X-factor as a reason behind his opinion.

11.title: No 'maai ka laal' can say HP CM Jairam Thakur's govt is corrupt: Rajnath
11.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh praised Himachal CM Jairam Thakur for his governance. "I can guarantee, no 'maai ka laal' in Himachal or across the country can say that there's even a blip of corruption in...Jairam Thakur's governance," Singh said. "He should be given another chance to make his government in Himachal," Singh added.

12.title: UP man kills sister, lover; goes to police station to confess
12.article_body: A woman and her lover were allegedly killed by her brother in UP's Farrukhabad and their bodies were dumped in a drain, the police said. The matter came to light on Sunday after the accused, Neetu, went to the city police station and confessed to having killed his sister Shivani (23) and her lover Ramkaran (25), the police added.

13.title: Ex-S Korean Prez to give up dogs gifted by N Korea's Kim Jong-un
13.article_body: Former South Korean President Moon Jae-in said on Monday that he plans to give up the dogs gifted by North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, which are legally categorised as state property. Moon's office claimed that the country's Presidential office seemed "negative" about entrusting the dogs to Moon. "If that's the case, we can be cool about it," Moon's office said.

14.title: Tirupati temple trust richer than Wipro, Nestlé India with ₹2.5 lakh crore net worth
14.article_body: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams' (TTD) has a net worth of nearly ₹2.5 lakh crore, which is more than the market capitalisation of IT firm Wipro (₹2.14 lakh crore), Nestlé India (₹1.97 lakh crore), and state-owned ONGC (₹1.74 lakh crore). The TTD revealed its assets include 10.25 tonnes of gold deposits, 2.5 tonnes of gold jewellery and 960 properties among others.

15.title: Prabhas was the first celebrity to post about 'Kantara': Sapthami
15.article_body: Actress Sapthami Gowda, who featured in 'Kantara', said that Prabhas was the first celebrity to post about the film on social media and added that it was special. "I watched 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' when I was younger...I'm a fan. So that was some validation for me," she added. Prabhas had praised the film on Instagram.

16.title: You're very quickly getting there dude: ABD on Suryakumar calling him the only 360° player
16.article_body: On being called 'Mr 360°' by Irfan Pathan, Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav, while referring to AB de Villiers, said, "There is only one 360° player in the world, and I will try to play like him." Reacting to Suryakumar's comment, AB de Villiers tweeted, "You're very quickly getting there dude, and even more! Well played [against Zimbabwe]."

17.title: PM yet to acknowledge this 'epic failure': Kharge on demonetisation move
17.article_body: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge criticised PM Narendra Modi-led government’s 2016 demonetisation move, saying PM is yet to acknowledge this "epic failure" that led to the "fall of economy". "Demonetisation was promised to free the country of black money but it destroyed businesses and ruined jobs," Kharge tweeted. "Cash available in public is 72% higher than that in 2016," he added.

18.title: Gujarat HC issues notice to state govt over Morbi bridge collapse
18.article_body: The Gujarat High Court on Monday took suo motu cognisance of the Morbi suspension bridge collapse, which left over 130 people dead and issued notices to the state government and other authorities. The court also sought a report on the matter by November 14. So far, at least nine people have been arrested in connection with the incident.

19.title: John Abraham was our only choice to play villain: 'Pathaan' director
19.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand said that John Abraham was his "first and only choice" to play the antagonist in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Pathaan'. Calling John a "perfect" fit to play the film's villain, Siddharth said, "We've made their rivalry look deliciously edge of the seat. It will be one hell of a thrilling showdown." 'Pathaan' also stars Deepika Padukone.

20.title: Indian stock market has shown phenomenal resilience: Jefferies' Wood
20.article_body: Global head of equity strategy at Jefferies, Chris Wood, has said that the Indian stock market has shown phenomenal resilience amid global headwinds and a significant monetary tightening cycle by the central bank. "[The] Indian stock market in the face of a very bearish global environment tells you how good the well-positioned interiors domestically," Wood said.

21.title: What is the law on 10% EWS reservations upheld by the Supreme Court today?
21.article_body: The 103rd Amendment of 2019 inserted Articles 15(6) and 16(6) in the Constitution to provide 10% EWS reservation to persons who aren't covered under the SC, ST and OBC reservations. The rationale was that the amendment could empower state governments to provide reservation on the basis of economic backwardness – determined by criteria like land size owned, annual income etc.

22.title: Palak, Mithoon host wedding reception; Sonu Nigam, Rupali Ganguly attend
22.article_body: Newlywed couple Palak Muchhal and Mithoon hosted a wedding reception on Sunday in Mumbai. Celebrities including Sonu Nigam, Rupali Ganguly, Smriti Mandhana, Aditya Narayan, Armaan Malik and Salim Merchant were spotted at the reception. Palak, who has sung for films like 'Ek Tha Tiger' and 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo', tied the knot with music composer Mithoon on Sunday.

23.title: Samantha promotes 'Yashoda' after Myositis diagnosis, shares pics
23.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu has returned to work "for a day" to promote her upcoming film 'Yashoda'. The actress had recently opened up about being diagnosed with autoimmune condition Myositis. Sharing pictures of herself on Instagram, Samantha said she borrowed "good friend" and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru's advice that "no matter what the day is like and how sh***y things are...show up".

24.title: Career in Journalism doesn't require specific qualification: Delhi HC
24.article_body: Delhi High Court has dismissed an appeal challenging the appointment of Dr Sanjay Dwivedi as the Director General (DG) of the Indian Institute of Mass Communication (IIMC). The court said, "[Pursuing] a career in journalism doesn't require possessing a specific qualification." Dwivedi's appointment was challenged on the ground that it didn't satisfy the minimum eligibility criteria for the post.

25.title: 48-yr-old man held for stealing ATM cards, withdrawing money; 21 cards found
25.article_body: A 48-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stealing people's ATM cards and withdrawing money from their accounts in Maharashtra's Palghar. The police have recovered 21 ATM cards and a motorcycle from his possession, senior inspector Pramod Bhadak said. He was caught following inspection of CCTV footage.

26.title: Jahangirpuri violence accused arrested again for trying to jeopardise peace
26.article_body: The Delhi Police arrested the alleged mastermind of Jahangirpuri violence, Ansar, once again for trying to create tension by taking out a procession in the area. Along with him, the police apprehended three others. The area witnessed violent clashes, including stone pelting, arson and firing between two communities during a Hanuman Jayanti procession on April 16.

27.title: 2 teenagers killed after race car runs off road in Belgium
27.article_body: Two teenage spectators were killed on Sunday after being hit by a race car that veered off the road during the Rallye du Condroz event in Belgium, local authorities said. An alcohol test on the driver and the co-driver came back negative. It is being investigated if or not the teenagers were in an area authorized for public access.

28.title: US teenager who killed her rapist escapes from probation centre
28.article_body: An 18-year-old girl, who'd pled guilty to killing a man she said raped her, has escaped from a women's centre in US' Iowa where she was serving her probation sentence, authorities said. According to probation violation report, the teenager was seen walking out of the centre and her GPS monitor was cut off. The teenager is a sex trafficking victim.

29.title: 6-month-old abused stray dog adopted by a family in Mumbai
29.article_body: A six-month-old stray dog named Rani, who was sodomised by a food delivery person in October, was adopted by a family in Mumbai. After mid-day reported the incident, more than a dozen residents came forward to adopt Rani and finally Prabhadevi residents Gokul Mundhra and his partner Sonal adopted her. The adoption was facilitated by NGO Bombay Animal Rights.

30.title: 'Brahmastra 2' makers approach Vijay Deverakonda to play Dev: Report
30.article_body: 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev' makers have reportedly approached Vijay Deverakonda to play Dev in the Ayan Mukerji directorial. "Karan is looking at roping in Vijay," a source informed Bollywood Hungama. Earlier, some reports suggested that 'KGF' actor Yash was also approached to play Dev in the sequel, but Karan Johar refuted the claims and called the reports "rubbish".

31.title: Allu Arjun, Rashmika's 'Pushpa: The Rise' to release in Russia: Report
31.article_body: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Pushpa: The Rise' will reportedly release in Russia in December. "Allu is currently occupied with other work commitments and depending on his schedule, the makers will lock the release date," a source was quoted as saying. According to the report, Allu Arjun will fly to Russia to promote the film.

32.title: AIADMK led alliance will win all 40 LS seats in TN, Puducherry: Palaniswami
32.article_body: AIADMK Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami claimed that the party led alliance will win all 40 Lok Sabha seats in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry in 2024. "Hindi was imposed in Tamil Nadu [when Congress was in Centre]. So...being in alliance with Congress, DMK doesn’t have the moral right to speak about Hindi imposition," said Palaniswami.

33.title: Kathy Griffin uses late mother's account after her Twitter suspension, tweets '#FreeKathy’
33.article_body: Comedian Kathy Griffin is now using her late mother's Twitter profile as her account was suspended on the platform for impersonating Elon Musk. Commenting on one of Musk's tweets about her account suspension, Kathy wrote, "Please do a better job running this company." In another tweet from her mother's account, she told Musk, "I'm back from the grave to say...#FreeKathy"

34.title: Did 'Mili' because father Boney started crying on phone: Janhvi Kapoor
34.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor, speaking about 'Mili', has revealed that she was not sure if she should be a part of another remake after she featured in 'Good Luck Jerry'. "Father (Boney Kapoor) got...emotional about 'Mili', he said...'If you don't do the film I will make it, I need to tell this story'. He started crying on the phone," she added.

35.title: Teams thought they'd got rid of us but now they can't: Pak mentor Hayden
35.article_body: Pakistan mentor Matthew Hayden gave a speech in the dressing room after Pakistan qualified for the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals following a win against Bangladesh. "Teams thought...they'd got rid of us...[but now they can't]...There'll be no one...[who'd] want to face us," said Hayden. "We are here and it's powerful because no one wants to see us here," he added.

36.title: Woman burned alive on suspicion of witchcraft in Bihar, 14 arrested
36.article_body: Fourteen people were arrested on Sunday for allegedly burning a 45-year-old woman alive at her home on suspicion of practising witchcraft in Bihar’s Gaya, police said. Furthermore, the police said that a month ago, a man died after a prolonged illness and family of the deceased man accused the woman of witchcraft, after which both families were at loggerheads.

37.title: Twitter left with a dozen employees in India after firing 90% staff: Report
37.article_body: Twitter has fired more than 90% of its staff in India as part of the global workforce reductions ordered by its new owner Elon Musk, Bloomberg reported. Twitter now employs only about a dozen employees in India, as opposed to over 200 employees previously, the report said. The layoffs affected about 70% of Twitter's engineering and product staff in India.

38.title: We know Pakistan are dangerous: NZ's Tim Southee ahead of WC semi-final
38.article_body: Ahead of their T20 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan on Wednesday, New Zealand's Tim Southee has termed the Babar Azam-led side as a "massive threat", stating that they'll have to be on top of their game to win the match. "Hopefully, we can continue the way that we've been playing," he added. India will play the second semi-final against England.

39.title: Mumbai's Gokhale Bridge closed for traffic from today
39.article_body: The Gokhale Bridge, which links Andheri East and West, will be closed for traffic from today for at least two years as BMC will start reconstruction work on the bridge. The traffic police have suggested six alternative routes for commuters. BMC decided to shut the bridge as it found the structure to be unsafe during a structural audit in September.

40.title: Who are the five people in Elon Musk's core team at Twitter?
40.article_body: Elon Musk has five people in his core team at Twitter to help him make changes to the platform. The team includes Jared Birchall, the head of the family office that manages Musk's assets, Jason Calacanis, an entrepreneur who's close to Musk, and Indian-origin engineer Sriram Krishnan. High-profile celebrity lawyer Alex Spiro and investor David Sacks are also helping Musk.

41.title: Mother, son concoct fake kidnapping story to frame neighbour in Faridabad
41.article_body: The Faridabad Police on Sunday booked a mother-son duo for allegedly concocting a kidnapping story to frame their neighbour on false charges to take revenge for a recent fight between them. The woman, in her complaint, said that three-four men kidnapped her son, alleging that she could identify one of the accused who threatened to kill him.

42.title: Tanker driver arrested for releasing chemical into river in Thane
42.article_body: A 32-year-old tanker driver was arrested for allegedly releasing a hazardous chemical solution into the Waldhuni river in Thane. The incident took place on Saturday when the accused polluted the river by releasing the toxic chemical into it from the tanker, police said. Accused has been booked under relevant provisions of the Indian Penal Code and the Environment (Protection) Act.

43.title: 12-year-old boy dies after cupboard falls on his head in Mumbai
43.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died due to severe head injuries after a cupboard fell on his head in Mumbai on Saturday. The boy was sleeping when a wooden cupboard attached to a wall fell on another cupboard, which came crashing on him. He was taken to JJ Hospital, however, he died during treatment. Meanwhile, police have registered an accidental death report.

44.title: Australia played very un-Australian cricket in T20 WC: Michael Clarke
44.article_body: Former Australian captain Michael Clarke has said that the Aaron Finch-led side played very "un-Australian" cricket in the T20 World Cup. "We picked an aggressive 11 in this World Cup squad yet played so defensively," stated Clarke. "Australia had to walk out there against Afghanistan and say, 'We're going to make 200 and bowl you out for 100'," he added.

45.title: 1,000 protesters march in Ghana demanding Prez Nana's resignation
45.article_body: Over 1,000 protesters marched in Ghana's capital city of Accra seeking the resignation of President Nana Akufo-Addo as the country faces an economic crisis. The protesters, who were wearing red coloured clothes, waved placards and raised slogans like, 'Akufo-Addo must go'. "High fuel price increments are killing the people of Ghana," a protester said.

46.title: Allu Arjun shares Pushpa 2's update, says it'll be 'Asalu Thaggedhe Le'
46.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun recently shared an update on 'Pushpa: The Rule'. Hinting that the sequel will be much better than the 2021 release, the actor said that he's excited for the Sukumar directorial. "If it was 'Thaggedhe Le' in 'Pushpa 1', it'll be 'Asalu Thaggedhe Le' in 'Pushpa 2'," he added. For the unversed, 'Thaggedhe Le' is Pushpa's popular dialogue.

47.title: 38-year-old man on way back home killed as bike hits 2-wheeler in Pune
47.article_body: A 38-year-old man was killed and his daughter was injured after a speeding motorcycle hit their two-wheeler in Pune. The deceased's wife lodged a complaint in the case. The father-daughter duo was on their way back home when the incident took place, police said. The motorcycle rider has been booked, police added.

48.title: Locals vandalise liquor den in Rajkot following cases of harassment
48.article_body: A  liquor den was attacked by residents on Sunday night following cases of harassment caused due to drunken men in Gujarat's Rajkot. The people had been complaining for a long time and decided to act on their own when no concrete action was taken. The crowd eventually dispersed after a police officer promised action against the bootlegger.

49.title: Man tries to kill neighbour disguised as woman in Mumbai, arrested
49.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 34-year-old man, Kamlesh Hatim, for allegedly trying to kill his 59-year-old neighbour while disguised as a woman. "The victim had given a loan of about ₹5 lakh to the accused...She...was constantly demanding the amount," said an official. The victim informed the police that Hatim was the person who had attacked her while wearing a saree.

50.title: Virat Kohli wins ICC Men's Player of the Month award for the first time ever
50.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli has been named the ICC Men's Player of the Month for October. This is the first time that the 34-year-old has bagged the monthly award. Kohli scored 205 runs in T20I cricket in October at an average of 205 and a strike-rate of 150.73. Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza and South Africa's David Miller were the other nominees.

51.title: 2 people make 85-yr-old give jewellery worth ₹2 lakh on pretext of gifting saree
51.article_body: An 85-year-old woman lost gold jewellery worth around ₹2 lakh after two people lured her into taking it off and giving it to them under the pretext of gifting her saree and cash in Pune. The accused told her that his employer was blessed with a child and that they were gifting sarees and cash to elderly women.

52.title: I'll be the coolest grandfather in town: Mahesh Bhatt on Alia's baby
52.article_body: Director Mahesh Bhatt said that he'll be the "coolest grandfather in town" to Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's baby girl, who was born on Sunday. "In the blink of an eye, a girl whom I carried in my arms, is now a mama," he added. Alia-Ranbir also shared a note in which they called themselves "blessed and obsessed" parents.

53.title: BBMP plans to fix nearly 3,000 km of roads in B'luru over next 5 months
53.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) plans to asphalt close to 3,000 km of roads in Bengaluru over the course of next five months, BBMP Chief Engineer BS Prahalad said. BBMP plans to asphalt 427 km of arterial roads in next 90 dry days, Prahalad added. We have asked ward engineers to submit the number of potholes identified, he said.

54.title: Match officials for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals announced
54.article_body: T20 World Cup 2022's first semi-final between New Zealand & Pakistan will be overseen by umpires Marais Erasmus and Richard Illingworth, third umpire Richard Kettleborough, fourth umpire Michael Gough and match referee Chris Broad. India-England semi will be officiated by umpires Kumar Dharmasena and Paul Reiffel, third umpire Chris Gaffaney, fourth umpire Rod Tucker and referee David Boon.

55.title: SL cricketer Gunathilaka suspended from all forms of cricket after rape charges in Australia
55.article_body: Sri Lanka Cricket has suspended batter Danushka Gunathilaka from all forms of cricket after he was arrested and charged with sexual assault of a woman in Australia amid T20 World Cup 2022. The cricket board will also provide all the required support to the Australian law enforcement authorities to carry out an impartial inquiry into the incident.

56.title: 14-year-old girl strangled to death by neighbour for rejecting his marriage proposal in UP
56.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly strangled to death by her neighbour after she rejected his marriage proposal in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The deceased had been missing from home since Saturday and was found dead in a sugarcane field on Sunday. The girl's father said that the accused had also threatened his family. The accused has been arrested.

57.title: Huge fire races up 35-storey tower near Burj Khalifa in Dubai, video surfaces
57.article_body: A huge fire broke out on Monday morning at a 35-storey high-rise building near the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. Videos showed flames engulfing the high-rise, part of a series of towers called 8 Boulevard Walk by Emaar, the state-backed developer in the emirate. The fire was extinguished later but black char marks could be seen stretching up the building.

58.title: Mumbai Police recovers unidentified body of 55-year-old man in Dharavi
58.article_body: The Mumbai Police recovered a decomposed body of a 55-year-old unidentified man trapped inside a drain in Dharavi, Mumbai. The investigation is underway and the cause of death is not yet known as the police didn't find any marks on the body. The police has sent the body to Sion Hospital for post-mortem and filed an Accidental Death Report (ADR).

59.title: Delhi's primary schools to reopen from Nov 9, offices running at full capacity: Minister
59.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Monday announced that the primary schools, which had been shut in view of the pollution situation in city, will reopen from November 9. He also said offices have started functioning at full capacity from today. Besides that, ban on construction work related to highways, roads, flyovers, overbridges, pipelines and power transmission has been lifted.

60.title: Imran Khan committing crime of treason: Pak Interior Minister
60.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah Khan while speaking to Geo News claimed that the country's former PM Imran Khan is "committing the crime of treason against the state". This comes as Imran announced that he'll resume his protest march. "Imran Khan only has one demand: he wants to be adopted by...institutions to make him sit on...PM's chair," Rana said.

61.title: World's tallest woman takes her 1st flight; airline removes 6 seats for her
61.article_body: The world’s tallest woman Rumeysa Gelgi recently took her first-ever trip on a plane after Turkish Airlines removed six seats and replaced them with a special stretcher for her 13-hour travel. Gelgi, who stands at 7 feet and 0.7 inches tall, had never previously taken a flight due to her Weaver syndrome, causing her to use a wheelchair for movement.

62.title: We condemn the way Twitter has sacked employees in India: IT Minister
62.article_body: Union Minister for Information Technology Ashwini Vaishnaw has said that he condemns the way Twitter has sacked employees in India. "[Twitter] should have given the employees a fair time for transition," the minister was quoted as saying by Business Standard. As per reports, Twitter laid off majority of its more than 200-member workforce in India across various departments on Friday.

63.title: GRAP stage-4 restrictions lifted in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves
63.article_body: The Centre lifted the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) stage-4 measures imposed in Delhi-NCR as the air quality in the region slightly improved. Ban on diesel vehicles, construction activities are among few of the restrictions that were imposed in the region as part of the GRAP stage-4 plan. However, restrictions under GRAP stages 1–3 will continue to remain in effect.

64.title: 62-year-old woman stabbed to death by son-in-law in Hyderabad
64.article_body: A 62-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death by her son-in-law in Hyderabad’s Old City on Sunday. His wife was purportedly residing at the victim's house. The incident occurred when the accused went to the victim's house. "He...pulled out knife he was carrying and stabbed the victim, causing serious bleeding that ultimately led to her death," a police official said.

65.title: Five arrested in Bengaluru for honey trapping man from Tamil Nadu
65.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested five people, including a woman, for allegedly honey trapping a man who had come from Tamil Nadu to meet the woman. The victim said that four men recorded their videos in a compromising position and threatened him. The accused allegedly took ₹50,000 and his Hyundai car. The accused further threatened him to pay another ₹60,000.

66.title: ICC names 8 best matches of T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage
66.article_body: ICC has named eight best matches of Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. The ICC included Netherlands' win over South Africa and said, "What a game, what a result and what a moment!" India's last-ball win against Pakistan and their defeat against South Africa also features on the list. Zimbabwe's one-run win over Pakistan has also been included.

67.title: I won't ban Twitter account tracking my private jet: Elon Musk
67.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk has said that he will not ban the Twitter account tracking his private jet. Musk, who recently acquired Twitter for $44 billion, said the decision shows his "commitment to free speech" even though the account poses a "direct personal safety risk". Earlier, Musk had offered $5,000 to 20-year-old Jack Sweeney to shut down the account.

68.title: Arhaan wants to learn filmmaking, assisted Karan Johar: Arbaaz
68.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan shared that his son Arhaan Khan is interested in filmmaking and has assisted director Karan Johar on his film for 20-30 days. "He is now excited about being on my film now...he'll join me in the last stage of my film 'Patna Shukla'," he said. Arbaaz's 'Patna Shukla' will feature Raveena Tandon in the lead role.

69.title: Section 144 imposed around TSPSC exam centres in Hyderabad
69.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in areas around centres conducting Telangana State Public Service Commission (TSPSC) exams across Hyderabad. The curfew has been imposed from 6 am on November 7 to 6 am on November 8, the police said. Assembly of four or more people within 500 yards of the centres will be prohibited.

70.title: Singer Palak Muchhal marries music composer Mithoon Sharma, shares pics
70.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal tied the knot with music composer Mithoon Sharma in Mumbai on Sunday. Singers Sonu Nigam and Kailash Kher, film producer Krishika Lulla, and television actors Rubina Dilaik and Abhinav Shukla were seen at Palak-Mithoon's wedding reception. The couple shared the wedding photos on Instagram with the caption, "And forever begins..."

71.title: Recent missile tests were practices to 'mercilessly' attack S Korea, US: N Korea
71.article_body: North Korea's military on Monday said that its recent series of missile tests were practices to "mercilessly" strike key South Korean and US targets like air bases and operation command systems. Notably, North Korea fired dozens of missiles and flew warplanes towards the sea last week, leading to evacuation alerts in some South Korean and Japanese areas.

72.title: Hundreds of fired Twitter staff on H-1B visa face risk of deportation: Report
72.article_body: Hundreds of Twitter employees who have been laid off after Elon Musk's takeover are H-1B visa holders, according to Forbes. H-1B visa is a non-immigrant work visa that allows US companies to employ foreign workers in specialty occupations. As per rules, these employees have a 60-day deadline to find a new job to maintain their immigration status or face deportation.

73.title: India, Pak shouldn't return after losing in semis, I want to see their final: Akhtar
73.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said he wants to see an India-Pakistan final in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "It shouldn't be that India come back after losing their semi-final against England and Pakistan are also returning in the next flight," he added. Pakistan qualified for the semi-finals after defeating Bangladesh. They'll face New Zealand on November 9.

74.title: Educational institutions shut in Assam's Diphu due to dengue outbreak
74.article_body: In the wake of a surge in cases of dengue, all schools and colleges in Assam's Diphu have been asked to remain shut until next week. In the last five days, 270 cases of dengue were detected in the Karbi Anglong district. "All preventive measures are being taken to combat the situation," a statement released by National Health Mission said.

75.title: Man arrested for abducting, trying to rape 8-yr-old girl in Indore
75.article_body: Shaharyar Mirza, a 50-year-old man, was arrested by police officials in Indore for allegedly abducting and attempting to rape an eight-year-old girl. Mirza took the girl to a deserted place and tried to rape her. A few locals observed the crime taking place and rescued the girl. A case was registered under various sections including abduction and POCSO Act.

76.title: SC allows Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren to challenge cases against him for illegal mining
76.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday allowed Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren to challenge cases against him for illegal mining. Soren had been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate on November 3 in a case linked to illegal mining in the state. After skipping the summon, he had said the probe agency should arrest him if he has committed a big crime.

77.title: 3 motorcycles belonging to cops set ablaze in Nagpur, probe on
77.article_body: Three motorcycles belonging to policemen were set on fire by unidentified miscreants in Nagpur. The policemen were on a patrol when the incident took place around 2 am on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. The fire was extinguished in half an hour after the fire department was informed. A case has been registered and an investigation is underway.

78.title: 52-year-old ragpicker dies after being hit by car in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar
78.article_body: A 52-year-old unidentified ragpicker died after he was allegedly hit by a car outside a liquor store in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar on Sunday. The car also hit two other people, Anu Gupta and Sushil Kumar, who escaped with injuries. "Some men were pushing each other in an inebriated state...[They] were in no condition to drive the vehicles," said a victim.

79.title: 3 men shoot Chandigarh liquor vend employee over beer payment, steal ₹1,000
79.article_body: Three unidentified men shot a liquor vend employee in New Chandigarh, allegedly over payment of beers. "The assailants shot Om Parkash after arguments and also took away ₹1000 cash. They closed the shutter of the liquor vend in a bid to lock the injured inside," police said. The incident took place between 9 to 10 pm on Friday night.

80.title: India reports 937 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 14,515
80.article_body: India reported 937 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 1,132 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India stand at 14,515. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,30,509, according to the ministry.

81.title: 32,000 kg packed marijuana seized in Spain in largest ever seizure
81.article_body: Spain's Civil Guard has said that about 32,000 kg of packed marijuana, with an estimated street value of about $63.74 million, has been seized and added that the seizure is the largest ever not only in the country but also internationally. The seizure was made following raids on farms and production plants. Nine men and 11 women were arrested.

82.title: Order CBI probe, anything can happen before AAP's truth is exposed: Sukesh to Delhi L-G
82.article_body: Jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekar has written a letter to Delhi's Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena, requesting him to direct an urgent CBI investigation against AAP leaders including Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Sukesh wrote, "Allow me to file an FIR as the pressure is getting too much and any undue event may take place before the truth about AAP is exposed."

83.title: Officials who allowed film studios to operate illegally in Mumbai to be penalised
83.article_body: BMC officials who failed to take action against five film studios in Madh-Marve region for functioning beyond their licence period will be liable for punishment, according to a confidential report recently submitted to municipal chief. "The quantum of punishment will be decided by the inquiry department. It also depends on what approach the commissioner takes," a civic official said.

84.title: 49 foreign universities look to tie-up with Indian institutes: UGC Chairman
84.article_body: University Grants Commission (UGC) Chairman M Jagadesh Kumar said at least 49 overseas universities have expressed interest to collaborate with Indian universities academically. "UGC is proactively contacting these universities. Several universities are in process of preparing MoUs," Kumar added. "These processes involve discussions and approvals within university statutory bodies," he stated.

85.title: Hyderabad to get 6 double-decker AC electric buses in January 2023
85.article_body: Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority has started the procurement of six double-decker AC electric buses which will start plying in the city from January 2023. The buses will be acquired on two years and two lakh kilometre warranty and an annual maintenance contract for next five years. Moreover, the buses will be able to ply in the city for 12-14 hours.

86.title: 2 buses collide as driver fails to navigate blind turn in Maha, 20 injured
86.article_body: Two state transport buses collided on Jawhar-Silvassa Road in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Monday. Palghar Police said that 20 people were injured in the incident. Those who were injured have been admitted to the nearest hospital for treatment, police added. Officials said it appears that the driver of one of the buses was unable to navigate the blind turn.

87.title: SC upholds 10% EWS quota, says 'It doesn't violate basic structure of Constitution'
87.article_body: A five-judge Constitution bench of Supreme Court has upheld the validity of the Constitution's 103rd Amendment Act 2019, which provides for 10% economically weaker section (EWS) reservation amongst the general category in education and public employment. "The law doesn't violate basic structure or equality code for taking into account economic criterion," Justice Dinesh Maheshwari said.

88.title: Woman, daughter caught with drugs worth ₹2.5 crore in Ambala
88.article_body: A middle-aged woman and her daughter were among three people arrested in Ambala for carrying drugs worth ₹2.5 crore. The two women are drug peddlers and were travelling to Ambala from Delhi in a private car, police said. They have been booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act. The woman and her daughter hail from Ambala.

89.title: Fire breaks out at international shopping store in Noida, no casualties
89.article_body: A fire broke out in an international shopping store for Mushkin products in Noida on Monday. Seven fire tenders were present on the spot and the fire was doused off. No casualties have been reported so far, police said. According to Gautam Buddh Nagar police’s media cell, fire broke out at Mushkin International B-39, under Phase-2 police station limits.

90.title: Zomato VP of global growth Siddharth Jhawar quits
90.article_body: Zomato's Global Growth VP Siddharth Jhawar has announced that he has quit the firm. He will be joining Tiger Global-backed adtech unicorn Moloco where he will run the firm's India operations. Kamayani Sadhwani, a Director at Zomato-owned Blinkit, has taken over from Jhawar as the head of the firm's intercity food delivery service.

91.title: Thane educator gets message saying she got work from home job, loses ₹10 lakh
91.article_body: A 35-year-old Thane woman educator was cheated of ₹10,70,000 after she paid the sum as investment in a company. She received a message from the company saying she had been selected for work from home job and will be able to earn ₹8,000 per day. Reports said the incident happened on September 3 but complaint was filed on November 4.

92.title: Several verified celebrities on Twitter change their display names to 'Elon Musk'
92.article_body: After Elon Musk's takeover and amid the company's new blue tick plan, several verified celebrities on Twitter changed their display names to 'Elon Musk'. Comedian Kathy Griffin, actress Valerie Bertinelli, Chris Kluwe and actor Rich Sommer were among these people. Meanwhile, Musk said Twitter handles engaging in impersonation without clearly specifying "parody" will be "permanently suspended".

93.title: MP woman tries to forcefully marry female friend in Rajasthan, arrested
93.article_body: A woman from Madhya Pradesh was arrested after she created ruckus at her female friend's house in Rajasthan, demanding to marry her. According to reports, the two women met on social media a few years ago. The MP woman reportedly sought a physical relationship and threatened to leak their chats online if her demands were not accepted, the police said.

94.title: Which 12 teams have directly qualified for 20-team T20 World Cup 2024?
94.article_body: Twelve teams have directly qualified for 20-team men's T20 World Cup 2024. West Indies and USA have qualified as they will host the tournament. India, New Zealand, Pakistan, England, South Africa, Australia, Netherlands and Sri Lanka have qualified as they are the top eight teams in T20 World Cup 2022. Further, Bangladesh and Afghanistan have qualified due to their rankings.

95.title: Twitter to delay verification changes until after US midterm polls: Report
95.article_body: Twitter is delaying rollout of blue tick verification marks to subscribers of its new $7.99/month service until after US midterm elections, scheduled to be held on Tuesday, The New York Times reported. Twitter had rolled out the service on Saturday for selective iOS users. Twitter said the service's subscribers will receive fewer ads and get priority ranking for quality content.

96.title: Biden calls Afghanistan a 'godforsaken place'; Taliban responds
96.article_body: US President Joe Biden while addressing war veterans in San Diego said that he'd been to "every part" of Afghanistan and added, "It's a godforsaken place." Following this, Taliban spokesperson Zabihullah Mujahid reacted to Biden's remarks, saying, "Those making such remarks are doing so out of their frustration and envy for Afghanistan." US withdrew its troops from Afghanistan last year.

97.title: Don't drink & drive: B'luru Police to citizens ahead of T20 World Cup finals
97.article_body: Ahead of T20 World Cup final match scheduled for coming Sunday, the Bengaluru Police asked citizens not to drink and drive. Taking to Twitter, the police wrote, "The World Cup final is next Sunday. We repeat, it's next Sunday so DONOT drink & drive today. Or next Sunday. Or any day. Nope." Special screenings of matches are arranged across Bengaluru.

98.title: RSS trying to destabilise state government: CPI(M) Kerala secretary MV Govindan
98.article_body: CPI(M) Kerala secretary MV Govindan on Sunday alleged that the RSS was trying to destabilise their government in the state. "The government has sought legal opinion over the Governor sitting over various bills and his attempts to unseat a majority of vice-chancellors in the state," he added. "We will move to any extent to fight this uncertainty," Govindan further said.

99.title: Police bust racket involved in illegal sale of oxytocin hormone in Pune
99.article_body: The Pune City Police's Crime Branch busted an organised racket involved in the illegal sale of oxytocin hormone in the city and arrested five persons. "Its use in dairy animals has serious adverse effects on humans," an official press statement read. Police also seized around 290 boxes containing oxytocin vials and ampoules worth over ₹53 lakh in the illicit market.

100.title: If I were Bangladesh captain, I would've ensured players see psychologists: Akram
100.article_body: Talking about Bangladesh who were knocked out of T20 World Cup 2022 after their recent loss against Pakistan, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "Bangladesh...[should] blame themselves." "If I were the captain...or coach of Bangladesh...I...would've made sure...the players see psychologists," added Akram. "The Bangladesh players made up their minds to...[only] hit Shaheen Afridi," he stated.

101.title: Laptops, emails disconnected within 2 minutes: Fired Brainly staff on India shutdown
101.article_body: A fired Brainly employee has alleged that the edtech company didn't handle layoffs properly while letting go nearly all team members from its India team. "CEO comes on the call -- announces India shutdown and within 2 minutes Slack and emails shut off, laptops disconnected," the employee said. They also alleged that Brainly didn't offer severance pay to fired workers.

102.title: Won't appear before ED, will attend Congress worker's b'day: Shivakumar
102.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has said that he will not appear before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday as he will be participating in "a party worker's birthday event". This comes after ED summoned Shivakumar and his brother in connection to the National Herald case. Previously, Shivakumar and his brother had appeared before the ED in October.

103.title: 300% growth in enrolment for Executive MBA program: SP Jain Global
103.article_body: The SP Jain Executive MBA is a global program which aims to transform managers into powerful leaders of tomorrow. The flexible 18-month program is taught by international faculty, has a diverse student body with 16 years of average work experience, includes opportunities to network via newly-introduced global immersion weeks in Singapore and Dubai, and results in an Australian degree.

104.title: My heart is broken: Nick Carter on brother Aaron Carter's death
104.article_body: After Aaron Carter passed away, Backstreet Boys singer Nick Carter penned an emotional post and shared some throwback pictures on Instagram. "My heart is broken," he wrote and cited "addiction and mental illness" as the "real villain" behind Aaron's death. "Now you can finally have the peace you could never find here...I love you baby brother," he concluded.

105.title: Being told to clean up pet dog's mess, Mumbai siblings assault neighbour
105.article_body: The Mumbai Police booked three siblings for allegedly assaulting their neighbour and her mother when they were told to clean up their pet dog's mess. The victim said that the dog defecated in front of their door and the accused didn't bother to pick it. When asked to put on a leash, the accused and her siblings assaulted the victims.

106.title: Man assaults, tries to rob mobile of app service auto driver in Pune
106.article_body: An auto driver, attached to a mobility service app company, was assaulted in Pune while he was on his way to drop off a passenger in Yerawada's Shastri Nagar Chowk on Wednesday. The accused tried to rob his mobile and when the victim resisted, he was threatened and thrashed. The victim has sustained injuries on the face, head and back.

107.title: Gigi Hadid quits Twitter after Elon Musk's takeover, shares post of fired employee
107.article_body: Model Gigi Hadid has quit Twitter amid mass layoffs after Elon Musk took over the company. "For a long time, but especially with its new leadership, it's becoming more and more of a cesspool of hate & bigotry," she wrote. She also shared a post of Human Rights Counsel Shannon Raj Singh's tweet about being laid off from Twitter.

108.title: World's largest uncut emerald unearthed in Zambia, people say it looks like 'Kryptonite'
108.article_body: The world's largest uncut emerald, unearthed in Zambia, weighs 7,525 carats (1.505 kg), according to Guinness World Records. The emerald, discovered by geologists Manas Banerjee, Richard Kapeta and their team in July 2021, was named Chipembele, meaning "rhino" in the local indigenous dialect of the Bemba people of Zambia. Social media users commented the emerald looked like fictional 'Kryptonite'.

109.title: Not everything needs to have bird in the name: Musk to Dorsey on Twitter feature's name
109.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk and its Co-founder Jack Dorsey got into an argument on Monday over Musk changing the name of Twitter's 'Birdwatch' feature to 'Community Notes'. "I still think...Birdwatch is a far better name...Community Notes is the most boring Facebook name ever," Dorsey tweeted. Musk responded to him saying, "Not everything needs to have 'bird' in the name."

110.title: Without Suryakumar's 61*, India wouldn't have reached 150 vs Zimbabwe: Gavaskar
110.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said India batter Suryakumar Yadav is turning out to be the player who is taking India to totals that they can defend. "Without [Suryakumar's] 61 not out, India would not have reached even 150 [against Zimbabwe]," added Gavaskar. India defeated Zimbabwe by 71 runs in their T20 World Cup match on Sunday.

111.title: Twitter employee quit his job so that his co-workers could 'keep their jobs'
111.article_body: A Twitter employee revealed that he resigned from his role at the company so that his co-workers "might get an opportunity to keep their jobs". Andrew Haigh tweeted, "This wasn't an easy decision but it was the right one at the right time. I left on my own terms." Haigh joined Twitter in 2016 and was based out of London.

112.title: Ex-assistant professor, addicted to betting, arrested for robbery in B'luru
112.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a former assistant professor for allegedly breaking into a house in Bengaluru and robbing a gold chain from a senior citizen. The accused revealed that he had suffered huge losses in cricket betting two years ago. He was dismissed from the college in which he worked for siphoning off ₹4 lakh, the police added.

113.title: 4 domestic helps rob businessman of crores in Raj, escape in his car
113.article_body: Four domestic helps robbed their employer’s house after serving them food laced with sedatives in Rajasthan’s Jodhpur on Saturday, officials said. The accused, including a woman, were hired without police verification. They decamped with cash and jewellery worth crores from handicraft businessman Ashok Chopra’s house, officials added. They also took his car while escaping.

114.title: Gal Gadot congratulates Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor on becoming parents
114.article_body: Hollywood actress Gal Gadot congratulated Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor as they welcomed a baby girl on Sunday. "Congratulations," she wrote in the comment section of Alia's Instagram post. Gal will be seen as the lead actress of Alia's Hollywood debut film 'Heart of Stone', which also stars Jamie Dornan. The Tom Harper directorial will release on OTT in 2023.

115.title: Video shows Mumbai man selling Rail Neer for ₹20 instead of ₹15, probe on
115.article_body: A Mumbai vendor sold 'Rail Neer' for ₹20 instead of ₹15 at Lokmanya Tilak Terminus. A video of the incident was shared by the Free Press Journal. After the video went viral, a senior Central Railway official said that an inquiry has been initiated. "If anyone is found guilty, appropriate action will be taken against the culprit," the official added.

116.title: There is no doubt that Rohit Sharma is not batting well: Harbhajan
116.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said there is no doubt that Rohit Sharma is "not batting well", having scored 89 runs in the five matches played so far by India in T20 World Cup 2022. "One can only hope that Rohit...[performs] in the last two matches," added Harbhajan. "Suryakumar Yadav is shining...and that's a positive sign for India," he stated.

117.title: Comedian's Twitter account suspended after she impersonates Elon Musk; Tesla CEO reacts
117.article_body: Twitter suspended comedian Kathy Griffin’s account after she changed her display name to 'Elon Musk'. Reacting to this, Musk tweeted that her account was suspended for mimicking a comedian and that she can “get her account back for $8”. Earlier, Musk tweeted, "Going forward...Twitter handles engaging in impersonation without clearly specifying "parody" will be permanently suspended."

118.title: Stubble burning up by 160% in Rajasthan, 20% in Punjab in Oct: Jitendra Singh
118.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh expressed serious concern over Delhi's deteriorating air quality and said that stubble burning cases have witnessed a rise of 160% in Rajasthan and 20% in Punjab this October as compared to October 2021. "The governments in the two states are not doing enough to check stubble burning," said Singh.

119.title: Iron bars pierce bus as it hits truck carrying them in UP; 2 dead
119.article_body: Two people were killed and 12 others injured after a private sleeper bus rammed into a truck carrying iron bars on Sunday on Yamuna Expressway when the latter reportedly slowed down at the cut for Sadabad in Uttar Pradesh. During the incident, the iron bars in the truck pierced the bus. The injured passengers were taken to a hospital.

120.title: Video shows PM Modi blessing couples at 'Papa Ni Pari' mass wedding event in Gujarat
120.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday attended a mass wedding event 'Papa Ni Pari Lagnotsav' in Gujarat's Bhavnagar. A video of the event shows PM Modi blessing several couples as they touch his feet at the end of the event. More than 550 women who have lost their fathers got married at the event.

121.title: Started hitting the ball & never stopped: Suryakumar on 61* vs Zimbabwe
121.article_body: Discussing his 61* off 25 balls in Team India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe, Suryakumar Yadav said, "[I] started hitting the ball and never stopped." "My plan is always clear," added Suryakumar. "You can scarcely believe that...finish. Keep the highlights...Watch them again and again," read a tweet from commentator Harsha Bhogle, expressing his admiration for Suryakumar's 61*.

122.title: Price of apples falls after huge arrivals in market in Hyd: Report
122.article_body: Price of apples has dropped sharply compared to the last three years following a massive arrival of the fruit in the market in Hyderabad, The Siasat Daily reported. "A dozen good quality apples cost between ₹180 and ₹200," a fruit trader said. This is due to "bumper crop in both Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh", the secretary of Batasingaram market said.

123.title: 19-yr-old kills self in UP over death of stray dog she fed regularly
123.article_body: A 19-year-old girl jumped to death from a water tank in UP's Meerut after one of the street dogs she fed regularly was injured in an accident and died. Seeing the dog hit by a vehicle, the girl brought it home and consulted a veterinary doctor. However, the dog was in severe pain and died in front of her.

124.title: Delhi govt to decide on ease in restrictions, reopening schools in meeting today
124.article_body: In a key meeting that will be held in the national capital today, the state government will decide on easing the restrictions imposed on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles and reopening primary schools. Reports quoted an official as saying that discussion will also be held around whether to continue with 50% work [from home] of government employees or not.

125.title: Chennai-Mysore Vande Bharat Express trial run begins, pics surface
125.article_body: The Chennai-Mysore Vande Bharat Express trial run started from Chennai's MG Ramachandran Central Railway Station on Monday morning. This is the first Vande Bharat service in south India, and the fifth one across India. The average speed of the train will be between 75-77 km per hour, covering the 504-km distance in around six and a half hours.

126.title: Meta to lay off 'thousands' of employees this week: Report
126.article_body: Meta is planning to begin large-scale layoffs this week which could affect many thousands of employees, The Wall Street Journal has reported. This could be the largest round of job cuts at a major technology company to date. It would also be the first broad headcount reductions to occur in Meta's 18-year history. Meta employed 87,000 people as of September.

127.title: 1 kid dies of malnutrition, 2 of unknown reasons in Mumbai family in 48 hrs
127.article_body: Three children of the same family died within a span of 48 hours in Mumbai's Govandi. While the doctors said that one of them died due to severe protein malnutrition, the cause of death of other two children are not known yet. Municipal Corporation Executive Health Officer said that this is a matter of concern and will be investigated.

128.title: 'Adipurush' to now release on June 16 next year, confirms director
128.article_body: Director Om Raut shared that 'Adipurush' will now release on June 16, 2023. He said that to give a complete visual experience to the audience, the makers needed more time to work on the film. "We are committed to make a film that India will be proud of," Raut added. 'Adipurush' was earlier scheduled for January 12, 2023 release.

129.title: Twitter asks some fired employees to return as they got 'laid off by mistake': Reports
129.article_body: After firing 50% of its employees following Elon Musk’s takeover, Twitter is now asking some laid-off employees to return as some of those were fired by mistake, as per reports. A report also stated that some employees were let go before the management realised that their work may be necessary to build the new features Musk envisions.

130.title: Edtech startup Brainly fires nearly all team members from its India team
130.article_body: Poland-based edtech startup Brainly has laid off nearly all team members from its India team. "Unfortunately, we were not able to maintain some of the roles focused on developing our paid plans and products," a company spokesperson said. Brainly employed nearly 35 people, mostly women, in India. It has offered departure packages to all 25 employees affected by the move.

131.title: Twitter to suspend accounts impersonating others if not labelled 'parody': Elon Musk
131.article_body: Elon Musk has issued a warning on impersonation on Twitter, saying, "Any Twitter handles engaging in impersonation without clearly specifying 'parody' will be permanently suspended." "Previously, we issued a warning before suspension, but now that we are rolling out widespread verification, there will be no warning," he added. This comes after several accounts on Twitter impersonated him.

132.title: Production cut in China to hit iPhone 14 Pro & Pro Max shipments: Apple
132.article_body: Apple has said that a production cut at its Zhengzhou plant in China amid COVID-19 curbs will lead to lower shipments of iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max models than previously anticipated. "The facility is currently operating at significantly reduced capacity," Apple said. Earlier, employees could be seen fleeing the plant amid curbs.

133.title: Twitter asking some fired employees to return after massive layoffs: Reports
133.article_body: After massive layoffs at Twitter that affected workers and teams across the world as Elon Musk took over the social media company, some fired employees are being asked to rejoin, multiple reports have said. At least five people who are "essential for Twitter's ecosystem" have been asked to return, said Business Insider. One person has rejected the offer, it said.

134.title: Won't allow trials of genetically modified mustard: Rakesh Tikait
134.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait said he won't allow the trials of genetically modified (GM) mustard proposed by the Centre. "When something is banned in the whole world...then what is the need for the Indian government to allow the cultivation of GM mustard," he asked. Tikait announced a demonstration in Lucknow on November 26 against the government's "anti-farmer policies".

135.title: Centre not serious about J&K polls or statehood: Congress leader
135.article_body: Congress leader Vikar Rasool Wani claimed that the BJP-led Centre is not serious about holding Assembly elections in J&K or restoring its statehood. "The Centre is...only hoodwinking people by issuing vague statements from time to time for the last three and half years," said Wani. He also sought support for the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' to defeat the "politics of hate".

136.title: Better late than never: Table tennis star Sharath Kamal on Khel Ratna
136.article_body: Table tennis star Sharath Kamal said the Khel Ratna award was "better late than never" and will inspire him to give one last shot at Olympic glory. The 40-year-old was on Friday recommended as the only athlete for this year's Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award. "At this age getting this award...is really wonderful. It's come pretty late," said Kamal.

137.title: Kolkata Police arrests suspected terrorist with links to AQIS & ABT
137.article_body: The Kolkata Police Special Task Force (STF) arrested a suspected terrorist with alleged links to Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT) and Al-Qaeda Indian Subcontinent (AQIS). Moniruddin Khan, a resident of West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district, is accused of producing fake ID cards and giving logistical support to terrorists. He is also accused of facilitating recruitment for terror handlers.

138.title: Want to break all previous Gujarat poll win records: PM at rally
138.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that BJP will win with a record margin in Gujarat this time and that he wants to 'break all his previous records'. "This election is not fought by Bhupendra or Narendra, the people of Gujarat are fighting this election," he added. Gujarat elections will be held in two phases on December 1 and 5.

139.title: ICC shares video of man in crowd taking one-handed catch, says 'Catch of the tournament?'
139.article_body: The ICC has shared a video of a man in the crowd taking a one-handed catch during South Africa-Netherlands T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "Catch of the tournament?" ICC captioned the video on Instagram. Reacting to it, a user wrote, "He might be the baseball player without glove...Stopped the home run." Another wrote, "He should keep the ball."

140.title: Holger Rune future of the sport, reminds me of myself: Novak Djokovic
140.article_body: Novak Djokovic hailed Danish star Holger Rune as the future of the sport and said he was reminded of himself a lot while watching the teenager. "We get along really well. Good friends off the court...I played him only once...good battle, four sets," said Djokovic. He added that Rune, along with Carlos Alcaraz, is the future of the sport.

141.title: 6 injured in mishap on snow covered Gulmarg-Butapathri road in J&K
141.article_body: Six people were injured in a car accident near Nagin on the snow-covered Gulmarg-Butapathri road in J&K after their vehicle veered off the road and toppled into an adjacent valley on Sunday, the Army informed. The accident occurred due to overspeeding, an Army press release said. The operation to rescue the car's occupants lasted for four hours, the communique added.

142.title: TMC leader arrested for youth's murder in West Bengal's Birbhum
142.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Kajal Shah was arrested for the alleged murder of local youth Faizul Sheikh in West Bengal's Birbhum. The alleged murder happened during a clash over control of a sand quarry, police said. "We have arrested 15 people, including Shah, and seized a number of crude bombs that were used in the clash," a police officer said.

143.title: Suryakumar has been absolutely phenomenal for us: Rahul Dravid
143.article_body: After Suryakumar Yadav scored 61*(25) against Zimbabwe on Sunday, India head coach Rahul Dravid said the 32-year-old batter has been "absolutely phenomenal" for the side. "Scoring at a strike rate that Suryakumar does, it's not easy...I think he's just really earning the rewards for a lot of the hard work he's put in on and off the field," Dravid said.

144.title: Taliban founder's burial place kept secret for 9 yrs revealed in Afghanistan
144.article_body: Taliban on Sunday revealed the 'secret' burial place of the movement's founder Mullah Omar, who had died in 2013. Pictures of the burial site, located in the Suri district of Afghanistan's Zabul province, have also been released by the Taliban. They showed a white brick tomb covered with gravel and enclosed within a green cage made of metal.

145.title: Pune-B'luru AirAsia India flight cancels take-off over technical snag
145.article_body: AirAsia India flight i5-1427 operating from Pune to Bengaluru cancelled take-off and returned to bay due to a technical snag. AirAsia India spokesperson said the airline regrets inconvenience to guests caused due to the delay. The Airbus A320, carrying over 180 people, safely rejected take-off after the pilots reportedly got a "brake hot" caution. The flight returned safely for repairs.

146.title: 5-member SIT formed to probe murder of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri
146.article_body: Amritsar Police Commissioner Arun Pal Singh on Sunday said that a five-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been constituted to investigate the murder of Shiv Sena (Taksali) leader Sudhir Suri. "SIT will not spare anyone and we will unravel the conspiracy," Singh said. Notably, Police had arrested the accused and said that he was "self-radicalised" and committed a hate crime.

147.title: ICAO to begin audit of India's aviation sector from November 9
147.article_body: The International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO), a specialised agency of the United Nations, will start its comprehensive audit of India's aviation sector from November 9, official sources told PTI. The sources said the audit will continue till November 15. The audit starting next week will be the first ICAO audit of the Indian aviation sector post the coronavirus pandemic.

148.title: With Bavuma in side, South Africa were a batter short: Ex-Bangladesh skipper
148.article_body: Former Bangladesh skipper Habibul Bashar said that with Temba Bavuma in the side, South Africa were a batter short in their games at T20 World Cup. "Except for Nortje, every South African bowler went for runs...But the South African batters were always behind the game [against the Netherlands]," Bashar said. Notably, Bavuma scored 70 runs in five T20 WC games.

149.title: Andheri bypoll result shows people rejected BJP politics: Congress
149.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole said the Andheri (East) bypoll result showed that people have rejected the BJP's "politics of horse-trading and terrorising political opponents". Shiv Sena (Uddhav Thackeray) candidate Rutuja Latke won the bypoll with more than 66,000 votes. The BJP had withdrawn its candidate from the polls stating respect for the demise of former MLA Ramesh Latke.

150.title: Apple to change iconic 'Hey Siri' trigger phrase to just 'Siri': Report
150.article_body: Apple is working to change its iconic 'Hey Siri' trigger command used to activate its voice assistant on Apple devices to just 'Siri', Bloomberg reported. Apple has been working on this for several months and plans to roll out the change either next year or the year after. Apple is said to be testing the change among its employees.

151.title: SA won't mind their chokers tag after losing to Netherlands: Bashar
151.article_body: After South Africa crashed out of the T20 World Cup, ex-Bangladesh skipper Habibul Bashar said that Proteas currently won't mind their chokers tag, especially after losing to the Netherlands on Sunday. "It has been established now whenever they play at the bigger tournaments like WCs, they always fail...South Africa started the tournament well...they should've won this game," Bashar said.

152.title: Man arrested with barking deer meat at national park in Odisha
152.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested after he was allegedly found possessing 2.25 kg meat of barking deer at Similipal National Park in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district, as per forest officials. The accused, Sridhar Pingua, was apprehended by a forest patrol team, officials said on Sunday. Arrows and a bow were also seized from him, Assistant Conservator of Forest Jadumani Kerketa said.

153.title: 21 children abducted by gunmen from Nigerian farm released
153.article_body: As many as 21 children who were abducted by gunmen last week from a farm in Nigerian's Katsina state were released from captivity and reunited with their families on Saturday, police said. Three of the captives' parents told Reuters that the children were freed following the payment of $3,400 as ransom. However, police denied that a ransom had been paid.

154.title: 19 confirmed killed after passenger plane crashes into lake in Tanzania
154.article_body: Tanzanian PM Kassim Majaliwa said 19 people were killed while 26 others were rescued after a Precision Air flight crashed into a lake on Sunday. Flight PW 494, which was going from the Tanzanian capital Dar es Salaam to Bukoba, fell into the lake due to a storm and heavy rains just as it was about to land.

155.title: Received a DM from Virat Kohli, was surprised: MTV Hustle 2.0's MC Square
155.article_body: MTV Hustle 2.0's MC Square has revealed that he received a DM from Virat Kohli on Instagram. "I was quite surprised," he said, adding that the cricketer also follows him on Instagram. "My friends and family are the ones who told me about it. This was the moment that I realised that I have achieved something big," said MC Square.

156.title: They're absolutely fine: Neetu shares update on Alia and her baby's health
156.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor interacted with some photographers while leaving Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital where Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor welcomed a baby girl on Sunday. When asked about Alia and the baby's health, Neetu said, "They are first class. They are absolutely fine." Alia and Ranbir had announced the arrival of their daughter through a social media post.

157.title: Central govt trying to destroy higher education in Kerala: CPI(M)
157.article_body: The Kerala CPI(M) claimed that the central government is trying to prevent the implementation of welfare schemes and destroy higher education in the state. "The BJP is using the Governor to destroy higher education...when the state government was taking steps to...raise it to global standards," said CPI(M) state secretary MV Govindan. He added that the BJP 'wants to control everything'.

158.title: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav inaugurates India Pavilion at COP27
158.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Sunday inaugurated India Pavilion at 27th Session of Conference of Parties of the UNFCCC (COP27). "I'm confident that...India Pavilion will continue to remind delegates that simple lifestyle...that [is] sustainable in nature can help protect Mother Earth," Yadav said. "[India looks] forward to the introduction of new technologies," he added.

159.title: Those wanting to be close to Rahul have hijacked 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': BJP
159.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Sunday said Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' "isn't of the public or Congress party workers" and that it has been "hijacked" by leaders wanting to be close to Rahul Gandhi. The Yatra will enter Maharashtra's Nanded on November 7. "[Ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray] has missed the bus," Bawankule said regarding Thackeray's upcoming state-wide tour.

160.title: PM Modi attends mass wedding event, blesses couples in Gujarat
160.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday attended a mass wedding event, 'Papa ni pari', at Bhavnagar in Gujarat and blessed couples. As many as 551 girls whose fathers had passed away tied the knot at the event held by a foundation at Jawahar Maidan. PM Modi urged the newly-weds not to organise a separate wedding function afterwards.

161.title: I will think about it: Bavuma on his captaincy after SA exit from T20 WC
161.article_body: South African skipper Temba Bavuma has spoken about reconsidering his position as a captain in the team after Proteas crashed out of the T20 World Cup on Sunday. "It's been a tricky time. To be considering that now, a lot of it will be emotional, in terms of my role as captain...I will speak to the relevant people," Bavuma said.

162.title: Ducati's Francesco Bagnaia claims MotoGP title in season's final race
162.article_body: Ducati's Francesco Bagnaia claimed the MotoGP world championship in the season-ending Valencia Grand Prix on Sunday. "World champion - it sounds good...That was the hardest race of my life...I started to struggle after a few laps, but the most important thing is we are world champions," said Bagnaia. By midseason, Bagnaia was trailing outgoing champion, Fabio Quartararo, by 91 points.

163.title: Got offers from Bollywood after the success of 'Kantara': Rishab
163.article_body: Director-actor Rishab Shetty has revealed that he got offers from the Hindi film industry after the success of 'Kantara'. "But right now I want to make films in Kannada only," he added. Speaking about Bollywood actors, Rishab said he really likes Amitabh Bachchan, Shahid Kapoor and Salman Khan. 'Kantara' has reportedly collected over ₹300 crore worldwide.

164.title: RJD made dent in BJP's vote bank: Tejashwi on party's Gopalganj defeat
164.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday said that the RJD had made a dent in the BJP's core vote bank despite its defeat in the Gopalganj by-polls. "In Gopalganj, where we used to lose by a margin of 40,000 votes in 2020, we lost only by 1,794 votes this time, despite them (BJP) having a sympathy factor," Yadav said.

165.title: Efforts being made to save those behind Morbi tragedy: Kejriwal
165.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal alleged that efforts are being made to save the people responsible for the repair work of the Morbi suspension bridge. He added that if AAP forms a government in Gujarat, it will construct a grand Morbi bridge. Kejriwal said incidents like the Morbi bridge collapse will continue to occur if the BJP is voted to power.

166.title: Youth celebrates his birthday on road, police make him clean it in UP; video viral
166.article_body: Police in UP's Lucknow made a youth clean up a road after he and his friends littered it with his birthday cake while celebrating his birthday. A now-viral video has shown police instructing the youths, with one personnel saying, "This is not your house." Many Twitter users lauded the police's decision to make the boys clean the road.

167.title: Those spreading hatred will be swept out of Gujarat in polls: PM
167.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the forces that indulged in spreading hatred and defamed Gujarat will be swept out of the state in the upcoming elections. "[I'm] getting...inputs that BJP will win with a record margin this time in Gujarat," PM said. "I have come here to beat my past records," he added.

168.title: Pre-poll giveaways not best ways to help poor: Abhijit Banerjee
168.article_body: Nobel laureate and renowned economist Abhijit Banerjee said that pre-poll giveaways are not the best ways to help the poor. Stating that this needs discipline, he offered a solution and said, "Taxing the rich is a good way." He added, "A dedicated fund is a way of reducing this equality and redistribution if we have the political will."

169.title: US failed in destabilising Iran: Iranian Prez Ebrahim Raisi
169.article_body: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi on Friday said the US had failed in its attempts to replicate the Arab Spring in Iran and "destabilise" the country, Iranian media reported. This came a day before anti-hijab protests in Iran completed 50 days. On Thursday, US President Joe Biden said, "We're gonna free Iran. They (protesters) are gonna free themselves pretty soon."

170.title: Queen Elizabeth & Tom Cruise developed 'secret' friendship before her death: Report
170.article_body: UK's Queen Elizabeth had developed a 'secret' friendship with actor Tom Cruise before her death, The Sunday Times reported while quoting a source. The 96-year-old and Cruise "really hit it off" over the summer, the report said, adding that she invited him for a "special tour of Windsor Castle with everything laid on for him".

171.title: Cut-copy-paste of old promises: Cong on BJP's Himachal poll manifesto
171.article_body: After BJP released its manifesto for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, Congress termed it a "cut-copy-paste" of their 2017 promises. It said that the BJP's manifesto in parts was borrowed from the Congress' 2022 election document. In its manifesto, the BJP has promised to implement the Uniform Civil Code in the state and to open five new medical colleges.

172.title: Did PM Modi's 'kai guna' lead to the Morbi bridge tragedy: Kharge
172.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi and asked if his "kai guna" resulted in the Morbi bridge collapse that killed over 130 people. "When a similar tragedy struck West Bengal, Modi had claimed it to be God's wrath for the ills of the WB government. Who was responsible for the tragedy here?" he said.

173.title: Delhi minister to decide tomorrow on reopening primary schools, other curbs
173.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai will hold a high-level meeting on Monday to decide on reopening primary schools and revocation of the order asking 50% of government staff to work from home. Centre's Commission for Air Quality Management has lifted stage four measures under the Graded Response Action Plan. It was decided as Delhi's air quality improved to 'very poor'.

174.title: Bank officers' union alleges violation of HR norms by Standard Chartered
