350.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first against Zimbabwe in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne on Sunday. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Rishabh Pant replacing Dinesh Karthik. India will finish on top of Group 2 points table if they win today.

351.title: Drugs worth ₹20 lakh seized from Nigerian national in Bengaluru
351.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a Nigerian drug peddler for allegedly being involved in drugs supply in Hennur PS limits and recovered drugs worth ₹20 lakh, including 230 grams of MDMA crystals, from the accused. Earlier in October, the Bengaluru Police arrested 11 people for drug peddling, out of which five were foreigners, and seized drugs worth ₹1 crore.

352.title: Cyberabad police raid mujra party at farmhouse, arrest 52 people
352.article_body: As many as 52 people were arrested after the Special Operations Team Shamshabad of Cyberabad police raided a farmhouse where a mujra party was being organised. A police official said that the party was organised by a former rowdy sheeter for his friends over the closing of his rowdy sheet. The arrested persons include four rowdy sheeters.

353.title: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor welcome baby girl
353.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor welcomed a baby girl on Sunday in Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai's Girgaon, Ranbir's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni confirmed. Alia, who got married to Ranbir on April 14 this year, had announced her pregnancy in an Instagram post in June with pictures and caption, "Our baby...coming soon."

354.title: Pakistan defeat Bangladesh, reach T20 World Cup semi-finals for 2nd time in a row
354.article_body: Pakistan defeated Bangladesh by five wickets in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Sunday. With the victory, Pakistan qualified for the T20 World Cup semi-finals for the second time in a row. Batting first, Bangladesh put up a total of 127/8. Pakistan chased down the target in 18.1 overs.

355.title: Did something very bad: PL footballer Kurt Zouma on cat abuse scandal
355.article_body: Talking about a video that surfaced online in February 2022 where he was seen kicking and slapping his pet cat across his kitchen floor, West Ham United defender Kurt Zouma said, "I...[did] something very bad...I have great remorse." "I learned from it, that's the most important thing, I'd say," added Zouma. Zouma was seen chasing the cat across his room.

356.title: BJP releases manifesto for Himachal polls, promises to implement Uniform Civil Code
356.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda released the party's manifesto for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections on Sunday. If voted to power, the party has promised to implement the Uniform Civil Code in the state. The party has also promised to provide over eight lakh jobs in a phased manner and to open five new medical colleges in the state.

357.title: It's a social impact partnership: BYJU'S Co-founder on Messi deal after announcing layoffs
357.article_body: Days after announcing layoffs, BYJU'S signed up Lionel Messi as a global brand ambassador of its 'Education for All' initiative. Meanwhile, Co-founder Divya Gokulnath said that this wasn't a normal partnership but a "social impact partnership". She said it was "saddening and anguishing" that EFA hadn’t received the same attention in the last 18 months as it did recently.

358.title: BMC engineer asks for ₹50 lakh bribe to halt action against company, held
358.article_body: A BMC executive engineer has been arrested for allegedly demanding ₹50 lakh bribe from a private company in Mumbai. Reports said that he demanded the bribe to halt action against an illegal construction inside the premises of the company. The accused's house was also searched by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) and ₹1.13 crore in cash was found.

359.title: He lost his mind: Di Maria on Messi's speech before Copa America final
359.article_body: Discussing Lionel Messi's speech before the Copa America 2021 final where Argentina defeated Brazil 1-0, Argentine winger Angel Di Maria said, "Messi lost his mind." Argentine defender Lisandro Martinez had earlier stated that one would have felt like eating the entire pitch after listening to Messi's speech before the final. The triumph helped Messi win his first ever international trophy.

360.title: Man thrashes 21-year-old cousin to death for delay in feeding pet dog in Kerala, arrested
360.article_body: A 27-year-old man named Hakeem has been arrested in Kerala's Palakkad for the murder of his 21-year-old cousin Arshad. According to the police, Hakeem thrashed Arshad for delay in feeding his pet dog with the dog's belt and a piece of wood. The beating reportedly caused internal bleeding, leading to his death.

361.title: Need to blend ancient knowledge with modern science, says Jitendra Singh
361.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Saturday emphasised on modernisation of indigenous texts of ancient knowledge as India seeks to assert its scientific prowess in the world. "There's scientific basis to this linking of ancient knowledge...modern science. What India has, others are not aware of it. We're also not aware of what we have...we have been reading their literature," Singh added.

362.title: Traffic restrictions imposed near Hyd's NTR Marg for Formula-E race work
362.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have imposed traffic restrictions in parts of the city today due to civil work being carried out at NTR Marg for the upcoming Formula-E race. As per the traffic advisory, traffic coming from Ambedkar statue towards Necklace Rotary will be diverted and traffic coming from Iqbal Minar towards Telugu Thalli will also be diverted.

363.title: Waiting for new sun to rise: Mahesh Bhatt on Alia-Ranbir's baby
363.article_body: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt said that he's waiting for "a new sun to rise" amid reports that Alia Bhatt is set to give birth to her first child today. "Waiting for a new sun to rise. A fresh sparkling dew drop of life," Mahesh said in an interview. Reportedly, Alia and Ranbir Kapoor arrived at HN Reliance Hospital on Sunday morning.

364.title: Alia Bhatt admitted to hospital, expected to welcome baby soon: Reports
364.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor arrived at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital on Sunday and are expected to welcome their first child soon, according to several reports. Alia's mother Soni Razdan also reportedly arrived at the hospital. Alia had announced her pregnancy in June after sharing a picture on Instagram.

365.title: Don't remember Pak player who impressed after being dropped as captain: Waqar
365.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "Kohli said, 'I got dropped as a captain, fine! I'll play as a batter and...be the best fielder'." "In Pakistan, you go home after you're dropped from captaincy. I don't remember any Pakistan player who...got dropped from captaincy and...[made] heads turn as a player," reacted former Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis.

366.title: Married man arrested from Thane for cheating women through matrimonial sites
366.article_body: A 42-year-old married man, with two children, was arrested from Thane for allegedly cheating women after contacting them through matrimonial sites, a Thane police official said. "He'd tell them he is divorcee," the official added. "A probe began after one woman registered complaint…Accused had contacted her between 2018 and 2020 and had cheated her of ₹13.60 lakh," the official stated.

367.title: Pak govt directs PEMRA to lift ban on broadcast of Imran Khan's speeches
367.article_body: After Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PEMRA) banned TV channels from broadcasting and rebroadcasting former PM Imran Khan's speeches and press conferences on Saturday, the country's government directed the media watchdog to reverse the ban the same day. "Our government believes in the democratic values, freedom of expression," Pakistan's Information and Broadcasting Minister said.

368.title: What just happened, unbelievable pictures: Akram as Netherlands knock SA out of T20 WC
368.article_body: After Netherlands knocked South Africa out of T20 World Cup 2022, former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram tweeted, "Wait, what just happened...unbelievable pictures from Adelaide." He added, "Congratulations to Netherlands! What a performance." The 13-run victory is Netherlands' first-ever victory against South Africa across formats in international cricket.

369.title: Shakib expresses dissent, refuses to go off after being given out vs Pakistan, video viral
369.article_body: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan expressed dissent to umpires and refused to go off after being given out against Pakistan in T20 World Cup. Shakib was declared LBW out off Shadab Khan after which he used DRS. The replays seemed to show he nicked the ball, however, the third umpire ruled him out. Shakib was then seen talking to umpires.

370.title: Rajinikanth to play cameo role in daughter Aishwarya's 'Lal Salaam'
370.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth will feature in daughter Aishwarya Rajinikanth's directorial project, titled 'Lal Salaam'. The actor will have a special appearance in the film, which will see Vishnu Vishal and Vikranth Santhosh play the lead roles. Lyca Productions will be bankrolling the project, while AR Rahman will be composing the film's music.

371.title: I called up Alia & Katrina first: Priyanka Chopra on 'Jee Le Zaraa'
371.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra said that she called Katrina Kaif and Alia Bhatt even before Farhan Akhtar came on board for 'Jee Le Zaraa'. She said she wanted to do a Hindi film, but "on the terms of women". "The stars aligned and we decided to do it. Hopefully, we will start to shoot it next year," the actress added.

372.title: Pune man thrashed on suspicion of being police informer, accused arrested
372.article_body: The Yerawada Police arrested a 32-year-old repeat offender in Pune for thrashing a 21-year-old man on Thursday on suspicion that he was a police informer. The victim, Rushikesh Mohite, has suffered injuries on his head. A police officer said, "There was [a] heated argument between the duo and the accused physically assaulted Mohite."

373.title: Musk agrees Twitter staff was previously 'selling verification badges for $15,000'
373.article_body: Elon Musk agreed to a Twitter user who claimed that the company’s employees sold verification "for upwards of $15,000". The user alleged that the staff would refuse to verify through the standard application and then "privately offer to verify users for $$ behind the scenes". In another tweet, Musk also said, "Far too many legacy "verified" checkmarks were handed out".

374.title: Sri Lanka Navy arrests 15 Indian fishermen for alleged poaching
374.article_body: The Sri Lanka Navy has arrested at least 15 Indian fishermen off Talaimannar in Mannar Island for alleged poaching in the country's territorial waters, an official statement said on Sunday. It added that the arrested fishermen will be handed over to the fisheries inspector. This comes after Sri Lanka and India held an international maritime boundary line meeting on Friday.

375.title: Elon Musk parody account posts Hindi memes, 'Lollipop Lagelu' lyrics; suspended
375.article_body: An Elon Musk parody Twitter account that posted several Hindi memes, tweets and Bhojpuri song 'Lollipop Lagelu' lyrics has been suspended. The account had led to confusion among users, with a Twitter user tweeting, "I am confused which one is original." Another user tweeted, "What's going on Twitter? There are two [Elon Musk] on Twitter with...similar profile and similar bio."

376.title: India reports 1,132 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 14,839
376.article_body: India reported 1,132 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 1,082 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India went down to 14,839 from the earlier 15,200. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,30,500, according to the ministry.

377.title: 2 cheetahs in MP's Kuno shifted to bigger enclosure, PM says 'great news'
377.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his happiness over the release of two cheetahs in Kuno National Park's bigger enclosure after completing their mandatory quarantine and said that the cheetahs are healthy and adjusting well. PM Modi took to Twitter and wrote, "Great news...cheetahs have been released...for further adaptation to the Kuno habitat. Others will be released soon."

378.title: I am lost for words: Netherlands captain after knocking SA out of T20 WC
378.article_body: Netherlands captain Scott Edwards said it's going to take "a bit of time" to take in their win against South Africa in the ongoing T20 World Cup. "I am lost for words...Another great experience, another big upset from the Netherlands," he stated. Notably, it is Netherlands' first win against South Africa across any format.

379.title: Yo Kanye let's talk, man to man: Singer Aaron Carter in last tweet before death
379.article_body: In his last tweets before his death, singer Aaron Carter had tweeted about Kanye West amid controversy over the latter's anti-semitic remarks. "Yo Kanye let's talk...man to man," Carter had written in his last tweet. The 34-year-old singer was found dead in a bathtub at his home in US' California on Saturday.

380.title: Pakistan-Bangladesh match becomes virtual quarter-final as SA knocked out of T20 WC
380.article_body: The Pakistan-Bangladesh Super 12 stage Group 2 match has become a virtual T20 World Cup 2022 quarter-final after South Africa got eliminated from the semi-finals race after losing to Netherlands. The winner of the Pakistan-Bangladesh match will get to six points on the points table and advance to the semi-finals. India have already qualified for the semi-finals from the group.

381.title: 22-year-old student arrested for selling drug-laced chocolates in Hyd
381.article_body: The Narcotics Enforcement Wing, along with Musheerabad Police, arrested a 22-year-old student, Rishi Sanjay Mehata, from Hyderabad’s Narsingi for allegedly selling cannabis-infused chocolates in the city. Police seized 48 bars of drug-laced chocolates and 40 grams of hash oil. "About 50% of consumers the accused was catering to are girls aged between 18 and 24 years," police said.

382.title: Deepika has calming effect, John is well-mannered person: SRK
382.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan, during an #AskSRK session on Twitter, opened up about his experience of sharing screen space with Deepika Padukone and John Abraham in his upcoming film 'Pathaan'. While he said Deepika has a "calming effect" on sets, Shah Rukh called John "one of the most mild and well-mannered person". 'Pathaan' marks Shah Rukh's first collaboration with John.

383.title: Railways asked to pay ₹50,000 to Mumbai man for non-functioning of AC in Duronto Express
383.article_body: A consumer commission in Mumbai has ordered the Railways to pay ₹50,000 to a commuter for non-functioning of AC in Duronto Express while the daytime temperature was over 40-degree Celsius. Shivshankar Ramshringar Shukla booked a first-class AC ticket to return to Mumbai from Prayagraj in 2017. Railways was asked to pay ₹35,000 for mental agony and ₹15,000 towards litigation costs.

384.title: India's spin bowling a huge concern, they need a wrist spinner: Gambhir
384.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has termed India's spin bowling as a "huge concern". "If you don't pick up wickets in the middle overs, and if you are playing against England in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, it can come back to hurt you," added Gambhir. "If India are missing anything, it is a wrist spinner," he stated.

385.title: Several rooftop restaurants demolished in Pune's Baner, Balewadi
385.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) demolished several rooftop restaurants in the city's Baner and Balewadi area as a part of its anti-encroachment drive. A total area of over 6,400 square feet has been demolished, the civic officials said. The action was taken against restaurants named Hotel Vintage, 7 Rooftop Hotel, Hotel Basuri, Hotel Soya Affairs and Hotel Rustle Nest.

386.title: 2 youths lathered in soap take bath while riding bike in Kerala, booked
386.article_body: Two youths have been booked for allegedly taking a bath while riding a bike in Kerala. Reports said that the youths were coming back from a sports event and decided to take a bath on the bike for fun as it was raining. They were reportedly lathered in soap. They were fined ₹5,000.

387.title: 22-year-old woman extorts ₹10 lakh from Delhi businessman; arrested
387.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a 22-year-old woman for allegedly extorting ₹10 lakh from a businessman and then asking him to register his property in her name or give her another crore. According to police, the woman threatened the businessman to expose their relationship to his family, who were not aware of this. She even threatened to file a false rape case.

388.title: At least 10 people shot outside a bar in US: Reports
388.article_body: At least 10 people have been shot outside a bar in US' Philadelphia, according to reports. Gunshot victims were reportedly rushed to a number of hospitals based on the severity of their injuries. A video has surfaced online, showing heavy police presence in the region after the reported shooting.

389.title: 10 years ago, people used to make fun of South films: Yash
389.article_body: Actor Yash said that a decade ago, when dubbed films became popular in North India, people used to make fun of South films. He said South films were sold at "a bare minimum price", used to have poor quality dubbing, and were presented in a bad manner. He credited SS Rajamouli for changing people's perception towards South films with 'Baahubali'.

390.title: Cricket of an extremely low standard: Irfan on Warner's dismissal vs Afg
390.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has termed David Warner's dismissal in Australia's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Afghanistan as "cricket of an extremely low standard". "He would have heard a few choice words if I was there in their camp. You are trying to play a switch hit against a pacer when you are still searching for...form," added Irfan.

391.title: Edtech startup Practically cuts jobs, holds salaries citing funds crunch: Report
391.article_body: Edtech startup Practically has reportedly fired permanent staffers across departments, while also failing to pay salaries to many of its contractual and permanent employees over the last three to four months citing a liquidity crunch and pending fundraising. While employees began receiving termination emails in early October, the exact number of laid-off employees is not yet known.

392.title: Police seize illegally stored Calcium Carbide worth ₹40 lakh in Hyd
392.article_body: The Commissioner’s Task Force officials along with the Musheerabad Police in Hyderabad arrested two persons and seized about 500 barrels of Calcium Carbide from their possession. The seized chemicals, worth ₹40 lakh, were stored illegally in a residential area in Bakaram. When Calcium Carbide is exposed to water or moisture, it forms highly flammable and explosive Acetylene gas, police said.

393.title: Passenger traffic increases at B'luru airport as 16.3 mn travelled this year
393.article_body: The air passenger traffic at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) increased as around 16.30 million passengers visited the airport till October this financial year, the airport said. Last year, 6.61 million passengers visited the airport during the same period. Compared to 2019, domestic passenger traffic increased by over 102% and international travel recorded 85% growth this year.

394.title: Couple on ventilator after Thane fire incident, their 7-yr-old son safe
394.article_body: Two residents of the 15-storey building in Thane, where a fire broke out on Saturday, have been reported to be on ventilator. They have been identified as 37-year-old Amol Kulkarni and his 33-year-old wife Vrushali Kulkarni. Reports said that their seven-year-old son is safe as he was not in the house when the fire broke out.

395.title: Again we faltered when it mattered: SA's Bavuma after defeat vs Netherlands
395.article_body: Speaking at the post-match ceremony after getting knocked out of the ongoing T20 World Cup following their defeat against Netherlands, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said, "[It's a] hard one to swallow for the guys." He added, "We knew it was a must-win game and again we faltered when it mattered." Netherlands defeated South Africa by 13 runs.

396.title: 2 workers die after falling into sewage chamber of an MNC in Pune
396.article_body: Two workers died of suffocation while cleaning the sewage chamber of a multinational company in Pune. "[They] were working on [the] suction pipe after opening the cover of [the] chamber when one of them fell inside the tank. The other person also fell inside the chamber while rescuing the first one," said a police officer.

397.title: Woman run over by her own car 3 times after stopping on a slope in Switzerland
397.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was hospitalised after she was run over by her own car in Switzerland's St Gallen. Police said she was getting something out of the boot when her car, which was on a slight slope, struck her after rolling backwards. It ran over her two more times as it rebounded after hitting another vehicle and then a pavement.

398.title: Twitter to soon add ability to attach long-form text to tweets: Elon Musk
398.article_body: Elon Musk has tweeted that Twitter will soon add the ability to attach long-form text to tweets, "ending the absurdity of notepad screenshots." Replying to a Twitter user who asked if the feature would be like Twitter Notes, Musk said, "Something like that." Notably, in some countries, Twitter has launched the $8 monthly charge for its blue tick subscription service.

399.title: Counting of votes in by-polls to 7 Assembly seats in 6 states underway
399.article_body: Counting of votes is underway for by-polls to seven vacant Assembly seats across six states. Polling for the Assembly constituencies, which include Gopalganj and Mokama in Bihar, Adampur in Haryana, Andheri (East) in Maharashtra, Munugode in Telangana, Gola Gokrannath in Uttar Pradesh and Dhamnagar in Odisha, was held on November 3. Munugode had witnessed a voter turnout of over 93%.

400.title: Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ metro barricades removal to start this month: MMRCL
400.article_body: The barricades put up on Mumbai roads since October 2016 for Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ metro will be removed starting this month, Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited's (MMRCL) MD Ashwini Bhide said. "Our attempt is to reinstate maximum roads before the 2023 monsoon. Only some sections would remain, where barricade withdrawal will happen by October, these would be towards South Mumbai," Bhide added.
